answers.answer: First of all I want to tell you that I'm so sorry you are going through this.  Its natural to have these worries.  I had 2 m/c last year.  After loosing the second I thought the same thing.  I was so scared that I couldn't have kids.  I ended up pregnant again before I even got another period.  I'm 33 weeks now.Don't think its your fault.  Its nothing you have done to cause this to happen.  I did the same thing for awhile.  Its a hard experience to go through.M/c are more common than you may think.  Hang in there.  Somtimes it takes a couple times to get it right.

M/c are actually a lot more common than you would think.  I'm sorry to hear about what you are going through, but it is still real early, so you probably won't bleed  too bad.  I had one at 11 weeks last June, got my period right after the bleeding stopped from my m/c, and was pregnant again right after that.  I have a 3 month old little one from that pregnancy.  So many women have a m/c at some point, and if it's early lots of them don't even know, unless they take a test they may be a day or so late and then have a heavy period.  Hang in there, I would try again right away if you are comfortable, lost of gals here including me got pregnant right away after a m/c and went on to have a healthy and successful pregnancy.  It's nothing you did, it just happens.  Take care of yourself and try again weh you feel up to it.

I know plenty of women who have diabetes and have healthy babies. As for thyroid disease my SIL just had a beautiful 9lb 3oz baby girl 8wks ago. As long as your problems are under control you should definitely be able to have a healthy baby. Don't be discouraged. You can definitely try again soon. I'm sorry you are miscarrying. It must be devestating. Stay strong and keep us updated.

First, I'm sorry to hear about your loss.  I recently experienced a miscarriage and had so many unanswered questions.  I was 6 weeks along in the pregnancy and started having a brown discharge, the next day it turned to red blood.  Bleeding continued for about 10 days, getting lighter though.  I finally had my period 5 weeks later and had cramps for about 3 weeks before my period finally came.  I really didn't have any large clots or cramping during the miscarriage though.  I would say I have had some really strange things happening with my body since the miscarriage which was 7.5 weeks ago now.  My HCG level was down to 5 two weeks after the miscarriage, but my hormones still felt like they were all messed up.  Everyone is different so it's so hard to know what the future holds for you.  Best wishes!

question: I was starting to spot on Thursday, so I went to the dr.  He gave me an exam/u.s./blood work.  He called me yesterday with the bloodwork and said I was having a miscarriage.  I was 5 weeks.  He said my levels were 113 earlier last week (low to begin with) and on thursday they dropped to 68.  I'm still not bleeding a lot.  Will I have cramps?  He said I have to wait until my next period to try again.  How long does it usually take to get your period again?I'm really scared, what if I can't have a baby.  I have diabetes/thyroid disease, both of which are in good control.  But after having a miscarriage after only five weeks, and considering my stupid diseases, is realistic for me to think that I can get pregnant, stay pregnant, and have a baby?  I feel like it's my fault, because I have diabetes.  I really want a baby and now I'm scared I wont be able to.
title: Miscarriage questions
